sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The seconde [seventh] sermon of Maister Hughe Latimer which he preached before the Kynges Maiestie [with?]in his graces palayce at Westminster, ye xv. day of Marche [-xix daye of Apryll], M.ccccc.xlix. Latimer, Hugh, 1485?-1555.
ca. 332 p.
By Jhon Day, dwellynge at Aldersgate, and Wylliam Seres, dwellyng in Peter Colledge ... to be solde at the new shop by the [sp--e?] Conduyte in Chepesyde, Jmprinted at London : [1549]
Title page printed within ornamental border. Date of publication from STC (2nd ed.). Includes marginal notes. Title has "Maister Hughe Latimer"; F₁v note ends "sed worthely"; "Cum gratia ..." below t.p. border. "Cum gratia et Priuilegio ab imprimendum solum." Imprint from colophon. Imperfect: print show-through and broken type, with some loss of text. Signatures: A-Y⁸, 2A-2D⁸, 2E⁶. Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
=======

ca. 332 p.
By Jhon Day, dwellynge at Aldersgate, and Wylliam Seres, dwellyng in Peter Colledge ... to be solde at the new shop by the [sp--e?] Conduyte in Chepesyde, Jmprinted at London : [1549]
Title page printed within ornamental border. Date of publication from STC (2nd ed.). Includes marginal notes. Title has "Maister Hughe Latimer"; F₁v note ends "sed worthely"; "Cum gratia ..." below t.p. border. "Cum gratia et Priuilegio ab imprimendum solum." Imprint from colophon. Imperfect: print show-through and broken type, with some loss of text. Signatures: A-Y⁸, 2A-2D⁸, 2E⁶. Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
Jhon Day
the [sp--e?] Conduyte
Aldersgate
Chepesyde
Peter Colledgeto be solde at the new shop
